body:
Yeah, we use net.InterfaceAddrs which I think doesn't care, we should probably iterate interfaces manually and check the relevant flags ourselves.

(That said, the only definition of "usable" we can implement is "does it have `FlagUp` set". That doesn't necessary mean it's physically connected to anything, or to anything useful, or is a physical interface to begin with, etc.)
"Usable" is probably the wrong term. Checking if the interface is considered up is exactly what i had in mind.

Please note that sometimes it is desirable to announce a non-local IP address. I use this to announce the IP address of a 6tunnel endpoint that converts IPv4 traffic for my IPv6-only Syncthing installation. Hence, I would prefer "usable" over "local interface address".

Syncthing is only able to collect interface addresses and external addresses resolved via STUN. I guess that your usecase works because STUN is able detect the public IPv4 of your tunnel?

Changing the behaviour for local interfaces won't impact STUN.

> Syncthing is only able to collect interface addresses and external addresses resolved via STUN. I guess that your usecase works because STUN is able detect the public IPv4 of your tunnel?
> 
> Changing the behaviour for local interfaces won't impact STUN.

Frankly, I added the address manually in the settings. It should not be filtered out, though.

https://app.bountysource.com/issues/97258542-syncthing-announces-address-of-interface-which-is-down

Would be nice if you could also look into adding support for #7456
Added $10 to get rid of this ðŸ˜„

issue.title: lib/osutil: Only announce address of interfaces which are up (fixes #7458)

issue.body:
### Purpose

Syncthing will only announce address of interfaces which are up (fixes #7458)

### Testing

Syncthing compiles
Check that Syncthing is announcing only addresses of interfaces which are up

### Documentation

Not sure if the change should be mentioned in the documentation

issue.title: Check interface for FlagRunning

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
As of #7458 we're checking if an interface is considered up. Go 1.20 added an additional flag which would be more useful:

> [Interface.Flags](https://go.dev/pkg/net/#Interface.Flags) now includes the new flag FlagRunning, indicating an operationally active interface. An interface which is administratively configured but not active (for example, because the network cable is not connected) will have FlagUp set but not FlagRunning.
